private_information: I can move disks A B C D E
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I can move so the team reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I can move disks F G H I J
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I can move so the team reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I can move disks K L M N O
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I can move so the team reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I integrate the agents outputs into a final plan and produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem
I ensure actions from different agents remain distinct and that the combined plan obeys all constraints
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final ordered list of primitive moves and a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that captures the multi-agent solution

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial configuration: left peg contains disks A through O from top to bottom, middle and right pegs are empty
Goal configuration: left peg contains B E F G H I J K L M N O from top to bottom, middle peg contains A C D from top to bottom, right peg is empty
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk can be moved at a time, moves are from one peg to another, and a disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A B C D E, agent_2 may move only disks F G H I J, agent_3 may move only disks K L M N O

compute_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Using the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves you are allowed to perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that move disks A B C D or E because those are the only disks you can move. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and is feasible given the evolving configuration caused by previous moves you list. Do not emit PDDL. Think step by step and keep the list minimal and correct toward the global goal.

You are agent_2. Using the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves you are allowed to perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that move disks F G H I or J because those are the only disks you can move. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and is feasible given the evolving configuration caused by previous moves you list. Do not emit PDDL. Think step by step and keep the list minimal and correct toward the global goal.

You are agent_3. Using the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves you are allowed to perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that move disks K L M N or O because those are the only disks you can move. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and is feasible given the evolving configuration caused by previous moves you list. Do not emit PDDL. Think step by step and keep the list minimal and correct toward the global goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from the three agents. Your job is to integrate these into a single consistent ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal configuration and to produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that captures the multi-agent solution. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing operator names or actions with the agent identifier. Provide the final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Also provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that reflect the initial and goal configurations and include agent-specific move actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are inconsistencies in the agent move lists, resolve them to produce a sound plan that obeys Tower of Hanoi rules. Target the FastDownwards solver in your PDDL choices.

orchestrator.prompt: Integrate the provided agent move lists to deliver a single feasible plan and a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem. Use the agents moves as inputs and ensure final plan respects disk ownership and Tower of Hanoi rules. Output the ordered move list first and then the PDDL domain and problem with clear tags.
